properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 7 at 9:35PM EST until January 8 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Snow Expected Tonight into Wednesday Morning...

.A cold front moving through the region this evening is bringing
the first round of snow to NW PA. A reinforcing, Arctic cold
front will enter late tonight. This Arctic front will bring a
burst of moderate to heavy snow with its passage overnight. Behind
the front, much colder air will surge into the region, resulting
in accumulating lake effect snow through Wednesday morning.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches.
Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility may drop below one
quarter mile at times overnight.

* WHERE...Southern Erie county.

* WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A burst of moderate to heavy snow will
accompany the passage of the Arctic cold front overnight.
Visibilities may rapidly deteriorate to a quarter mile or less
in this band of robust snow. Behind the arctic front, snow will
transition to traditional lake effect snow with the greatest
accumulation expected in areas east of Interstate 79 and south
of Interstate 90 in Erie County.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and
traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY
